meanings.definition: To force (someone) to join a ship lacking a full crew by drugging them or using other underhanded methods.
meanings.sent1: The pirates shanghais the unsuspecting sailor onto their ship.
meanings.sent2: He was shanghaied into working on the ship without his consent.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crew decided to Shanghai their friend as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The recruiter shanghais talented individuals to join their team.
meanings.sent5: The villains shanghais innocent people into their criminal activities.

meanings.sent1: Shanghais is a bustling city known for its modern skyline.
meanings.sent2: I visited Shanghai last summer and was amazed by its vibrant culture.
meanings.sent3: In Shanghai, you can find delicious street food on every corner.
meanings.sent4: The lights of Shanghai at night are like a sea of stars.
meanings.sent5: Shanghai's rapid development is truly impressive.
